title: This Historic Train Climbs the Tallest Mountain in New England—and It Has Prime Fall Foliage Views

title: Hundreds of Mt. Everest Climbers Stuck on Mountain
description: Nearly 1,000 climbers were trapped on Mt. Everest by a blizzard ... and, while several hundred are safely down, a majority are still stuck up there. The BBC -- citing Chinese state media -- reports rescure efforts are underway, with authorities and…

title: More than 350 trekkers escape blizzard-hit Everest, hundreds still stranded
description: Rescued trekkers reach China's Qudang township while 200 others still face treacherous Everest conditions awaiting help.

title: Polish skier becomes first to climb, ski down Everest without bottled oxygen
description: In 2018, the Polish climber was the first person to ski down Pakistan’s K2, the second highest mountain in the world.

author: Express Web Desk

title: All Mt. Fuji summit trails are now closed as hiking season ends
description: But as one season of Fuji fun ends, another is just beginning. Mt. Fuji may be a timeless symbol of Japan, but that doesn’t mean that people can hike it anytime they want, and as of Wednesday, Japan’s tallest mountain is closed. There are four trails that lea…

title: Over 200 hikers still stranded as blizzard blankets Mount Everest
description: Chinese rescuers were on Monday rushing to evacuate hundreds of hikers stranded on the eastern slope of the world's highest mountain, Mount Everest, after heavy snowfall blanketed campsites over the weekend

title: 102-Year-Old Man Becomes the Oldest Person to Ever Summit Mount Fuji

102-Year-Old Man Becomes the Oldest Person to Ever Summit Mount Fuji

title: Taiwan showcases chipmaking prowess as a private exhibitor at Osaka Expo

title: Australia’s Flagship Renewable Project Stumbles On Rising Costs
description: Australia’s multibillion-dollar plan to turn its tallest mountain range into a giant pumped-hydro battery faces new roadblocks due to mounting costs and missed productivity targets.

title: Hundreds of hikers are trapped on Mount Everest after a snowstorm
description: A hiker who rushed to descend before snow blocked the way said that others still on the mountain told him the snow was 3 feet deep and had crushed tents.
